metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13628 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.Description: wolfSSL and wolfCrypt 4.0.0 and earlier (when configured without --enable-fpecc, --enable-sp, or --enable-sp-math) contain a timing side channel in ECDSA signature generation. This allows a local attacker, able to precisely measure the duration of signature operations, to infer information about the nonces used and potentially mount a lattice attack to recover the private key used. The issue occurs because ecc.c scalar multiplication might leak the bit length.

criterions.comment: wolfssl package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.0+dfsg-2').
